messages.title: Action for our NHS
messages.content: Labour and Plaid are wasting a staggering £1 billion in NHS. They'll install more scrutiny around money funding on bureaucracy and give healthcare professionals control resulting in more patients being treated at home. The Welsh Lib Dems will cut out the waste and make sure hospitals have the staff, beds and equipment to cope with demand.

messages.title: Action for jobs and the economy
messages.content: Labour gave North Wales a raw deal with recent economic development projects. South West Wales gets £680 per person for transport compared to just 68p per person for North Wales. Aled Roberts is leading the charge to make that right.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut out waste in NHS spending, direct funds towards improving patient care and increase efficiency.
Address the imbalance in economic development funding between North and South West Wales.

issues.economy: Labour has given North Wales a raw deal with economic development, with a significant discrepancy in transport investment between North and South West Wales.
issues.health: Labour and Plaid have been accused of wasting £1 billion in the NHS, with proposals to improve scrutiny around funding and empower healthcare professionals.

politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting for jobs for North Wales.

images.caption: Aled Roberts with party members and constituents.
Graph illustrating economic disparity between North and South West Wales.
